docfields.name: KColorCollection
docfields.text: This class makes it easy to handle color collections sometimes referred to as This class can read and write collections from and to a file This class uses the palette file format Waldo Bastian

docfields.name: KColorCollection::Editable
docfields.text: editable() setEditable()

docfields.name: KColorCollection::Yes
docfields.text: Collection may be edited

docfields.name: KColorCollection::No
docfields.text: Collection may not be edited

docfields.name: KColorCollection::Ask
docfields.text: Ask user before editing

docfields.name: KColorCollection::KColorCollection
docfields.text: Creates a KColorCollection from a file the filename is derived from the name name The name of collection as returned by installedCollections()

docfields.name: KColorCollection::addColor
docfields.text: newColor The color to add newColorName The name of the color null to remove the name The index of the added color

docfields.name: KColorCollection::changeColor
docfields.text: index Index of the color to change newColor The new color newColorName The new color name null to remove the name The index of the new color or if the color couldn t be changed

docfields.name: KColorCollection::changeColor
docfields.text: oldColor The original color newColor The new color newColorName The new color name null to remove the name The index of the new color or if the color couldn t be changed

docfields.name: KColorCollection::color
docfields.text: index the index of the desired color The index color of the collection null if not found

docfields.name: KColorCollection::count
docfields.text: the number of colors

docfields.name: KColorCollection::description
docfields.text: the description of the collection

docfields.name: KColorCollection::editable
docfields.text: the state of the collection

docfields.name: KColorCollection::findColor
docfields.text: color the color to find The index of the color in the collection or if the color is not found

docfields.name: KColorCollection::name
docfields.text: the name of the collection

docfields.name: KColorCollection::name
docfields.text: index the index of the color The name of the index color Note that not all collections have named the colors Null is returned if the color does not exist or has no name

docfields.name: KColorCollection::name
docfields.text: The name of color according to this collection Note that not all collections have named the colors Note also that each collection can give the same color a different name

docfields.name: KColorCollection::save
docfields.text: true if successful

docfields.name: KColorCollection::setDescription
docfields.text: desc the new description

docfields.name: KColorCollection::setEditable
docfields.text: editable the state of the collection

docfields.name: KColorCollection::setName
docfields.text: name the name of the collection

docfields.name: KColorCollection::installedCollections
docfields.text: A list with installed color collection names

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo
docfields.text: This class provides cross-platform information about the state of the keyboard s modifier keys and the mouse buttons and allows to change the state as well It recognizes two states a key can be in locked eg caps-locked aka toggled latched the key is temporarily locked but will be unlocked upon the next keypress An application can either query the states synchronously isKeyLatched isKeyLocked or connect to KModifierKeyInfo s signals to be notified about changes keyLatched keyLocked

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::buttonPressed
docfields.text: button The mouse button that changed state pressed true if the mouse button is now pressed false if is released

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::keyAdded
docfields.text: key The key that was discovered

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::keyLatched
docfields.text: key The key that changed state latched true if the key is now latched false if it isn t

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::keyLocked
docfields.text: key The key that changed state locked true if the key is now locked false if it isn t

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::keyPressed
docfields.text: key The key that changed state pressed true if the key is now pressed false if is released

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::keyRemoved
docfields.text: key The key that vanished

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::isButtonPressed
docfields.text: button The mouse button to check true if the mouse button is pressed false if the mouse button is not pressed or its state is unknown

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::isKeyLatched
docfields.text: key The key to check true if the key is latched false if the key is not latched or unknown isKeyPressed isKeyLocked keyLatched

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::isKeyLocked
docfields.text: key The key to check true if the key is locked false if the key is not locked or unknown isKeyPressed isKeyLatched keyLocked

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::isKeyPressed
docfields.text: key The key to check true if the key is pressed false if the key is not pressed or unknown isKeyLatched isKeyLocked keyPressed

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::knownKeys
docfields.text: A list of known keys of which states will be reported

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::knowsKey
docfields.text: key The key to check true if the key is available false if it is unknown

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::setKeyLatched
docfields.text: key The key to latch latched true to latch the key false to unlatch it false if the key is unknown true doesn t guarantee you the operation worked

docfields.name: KModifierKeyInfo::setKeyLocked
docfields.text: key The key to lock latched true to lock the key false to unlock it false if the key is unknown true doesn t guarantee you the operation worked

docfields.name: KSharedPixmapCacheMixin
docfields.text: This class can be used to share images between different processes which is useful when it is known that such images will be used across many processes or when creating the image is expensive In addition the class also supports caching QPixmaps in a single process using the setPixmapCaching() function Tips for use If you already have QPixmaps that you intend to use and you do not need access to the actual image data then try to store and retrieve QPixmaps for use On the other hand if you will need to store and retrieve actual image data to modify the image after retrieval for instance then you should use QImage to save the conversion cost from QPixmap to QImage KSharedPixmapCacheMixin is a subclass of KSharedDataCache so all of the methods that can be used with KSharedDataCache can be used with KSharedPixmapCacheMixin with the exception of KSharedDataCache::insert() and KSharedDataCache::find() Michael Pyne 4.5

docfields.name: KSharedPixmapCacheMixin::KSharedPixmapCacheMixin
docfields.text: cacheName Name of the cache to use defaultCacheSize The default size in bytes of the cache The actual on-disk size will be slightly larger If the cache already exists it will not be resized If it is required to resize the cache then use the deleteCache() function to remove that cache first expectedItemSize The expected general size of the items to be added to the image cache in bytes Use 0 if you just want a default item size

docfields.name: KSharedPixmapCacheMixin::clear
docfields.text: In addition any cached pixmaps as per setPixmapCaching() are also removed

docfields.name: KSharedPixmapCacheMixin::findImage
docfields.text: If no such image exists destination is unchanged true if the image identified by key existed false otherwise

docfields.name: KSharedPixmapCacheMixin::findPixmap
docfields.text: If no such pixmap exists destination is unchanged true if the pixmap identified by key existed false otherwise setPixmapCaching()

docfields.name: KSharedPixmapCacheMixin::insertImage
docfields.text: This variant is preferred over insertPixmap() if your source data is already a QImage if it is essential that the image be in shared memory such as for SVG icons which have a high render time or if it will need to be in QImage form after it is retrieved from the cache key Name to access image with image The image to add to the shared cache true if the image was successfully cached false otherwise

docfields.name: KSharedPixmapCacheMixin::insertPixmap
docfields.text: The pixmap must be converted to a QImage in order to be stored into shared memory In order to prevent unnecessary conversions from taking place pixmap will also be cached but not in shared memory and would be accessible using findPixmap() if pixmap caching is enabled key Name to access pixmap with pixmap The pixmap to add to the cache true if the pixmap was successfully cached false otherwise setPixmapCaching()

docfields.name: KWordWrap
docfields.text: That means not letting a letter alone on the last line breaking at punctuation signs not only at spaces improved handling of and improved handling of e.g for paths Usage call the static method formatText with the text to wrap and the constraining rectangle etc it will return an instance of KWordWrap containing internal data result of the word-wrapping From that instance you can retrieve the boundingRect and invoke drawing This design allows to call the word-wrap algorithm only when the text changes and not every time we want to know the bounding rect or draw the text David Faure

docfields.name: KWordWrap::boundingRect
docfields.text: the bounding rect calculated by formatText The width is the width of the widest text line and never wider than the rectangle given to formatText The height is the text block X and Y are always 0

docfields.name: KWordWrap::drawText
docfields.text: Flags are for alignment e.g Qt::AlignHCenter Default is Qt::AlignAuto painter the QPainter to use x the horizontal position of the text y the vertical position of the text flags the ORed text alignment flags from the Qt namespace ORed with FadeOut if you want the text to fade out if it does not fit the painter s background must be set accordingly

docfields.name: KWordWrap::truncatedString
docfields.text: the original string truncated to the first line If dots was set is appended in case the string was truncated Bug Note that the come out of the bounding rect

docfields.name: KWordWrap::wrappedString
docfields.text: the original string with inserted where the text is broken by the wordwrap algorithm

docfields.name: KWordWrap::drawFadeoutText
docfields.text: p the painter to use Must have set the pen for the text color and the background for the color to fade out x the horizontal position of the text y the vertical position of the text maxW the maximum width of the text including the fade-out effect t the text to draw

docfields.name: KWordWrap::drawTruncateText
docfields.text: p the painter to use x the horizontal position of the text y the vertical position of the text maxW the maximum width of the text including the t the text to draw

docfields.name: KWordWrap::formatText
docfields.text: fm Font metrics for the chosen font Better cache it creating a QFontMetrics is expensive r Constraining rectangle Only the width and height matter With negative height the complete text will be rendered flags currently unused str The text to be wrapped len Length of text to wrap default is for all a KWordWrap instance The caller is responsible for storing and deleting the result

docfields.name: KColorMimeData
docfields.text: The according MIME type is set to application/x-color See the Qt drag n drop documentation

docfields.name: KColorMimeData::canDecode
docfields.text: First checks for application/x-color and if that fails for a text/plain entry which represents a color in the format hexnumbers

docfields.name: KColorMimeData::createDrag
docfields.text: Either you have to start this drag or delete it The drag object s mime data has the application/x-color and text/plain type set and a pixmap filled with the specified color which is going to be displayed next to the mouse cursor

docfields.name: KColorMimeData::fromMimeData
docfields.text: First tries application/x-color and if that fails a text/plain entry which represents a color in the format hexnumbers If this fails too an invalid QColor object is returned use QColor::isValid() to test it

docfields.name: KColorUtils::contrastRatio
docfields.text: A contrast ration of 5 1 result 5.0 is the minimum for text to be considered readable large text can go as low as 3 1 The ratio ranges from 1 1 result 1.0 to 21 1 result 21.0 KColorUtils::luma

docfields.name: KColorUtils::darken
docfields.text: amount 1.0 gives black amount 0.5 results in a color whose luma is halfway between 0.0 and that of the original color amount 0.0 gives the original color amount gives a color that is twice as far from black as the original color that is luma(result) 2*luma color amount factor by which to adjust the luma component of the color chromaGain optional factor by which to adjust the chroma component of the color 1.0 means no change 0.0 minimizes chroma KColorUtils::shade

docfields.name: KColorUtils::lighten
docfields.text: amount 1.0 gives white amount 0.5 results in a color whose luma is halfway between 1.0 and that of the original color amount 0.0 gives the original color amount gives a color that is twice as far from white as the original color that is luma(result) 1.0 2* 1.0 luma(color) amount factor by which to adjust the luma component of the color chromaInverseGain optional factor by which to adjust the chroma component of the color 1.0 means no change 0.0 maximizes chroma KColorUtils::shade

docfields.name: KColorUtils::luma
docfields.text: Luma is weighted sum of gamma-adjusted R G B components of a color The result is similar to qGray The range is from 0.0 black to 1.0 white KColorUtils::darken() KColorUtils::lighten() and KColorUtils::shade() operate on the luma of a color

docfields.name: KColorUtils::mix
docfields.text: c1 first color c2 second color bias weight to be used for the mix bias 0 gives c1 bias 1 gives c2 bias 0.5 gives a 50 blend of c1 and c2

docfields.name: KColorUtils::overlayColors
docfields.text: base the base color alpha channel is ignored paint the color to be overlayed onto the base color comp the CompositionMode used to do the blending

docfields.name: KColorUtils::shade
docfields.text: The amount is added to the corresponding component lumaAmount amount by which to adjust the luma component of the color 0.0 results in no change turns anything black 1.0 turns anything white chromaAmount optional amount by which to adjust the chroma component of the color 0.0 results in no change minimizes chroma 1.0 maximizes chroma KColorUtils::luma

docfields.name: KColorUtils::tint
docfields.text: This function is meant for creating additional colors withings the same class background foreground from colors in a different class Therefore when amount is low the luma of base is mostly preserved while the hue and chroma of color is mostly inherited base color to be tinted color color with which to tint amount how strongly to tint the base 0.0 gives base 1.0 gives color

docfields.name: index
docfields.text: KDE GUI Addons Utilities for graphical user interfaces Introduction The KDE GUI addons provide utilities for graphical user interfaces in the areas of colors fonts text images keyboard input
